isis.stitle: SINGLE SPEED REAR AXLE: INTERNATIONAL - INSTALL - RING GEAR AND PINION TOOTH CONTRACT PATTERN ( Figure 64 )

svcproc.title: RING GEAR AND PINION TOOTH CONTRACT PATTERN ( Figure 64)
svcproc.para: The toe of the gear tooth is the portion of the tooth surface at the end towards the center.
The heel of the gear tooth is the portion of the tooth surface at the outer end.
The top land of a gear tooth is the surface of the top of the tooth.

step1.para: Paint 1/4 ring gear with marking compound and rotate with pinion to obtain contact pattern ( Figure 65).
The tooth contact patterns should have the same general shape and position as the ring gear teeth shown in Figure 66.

If the pattern is concentrated more toward the heel (as shown in Figure 67), backlash must be reduced. Recheck backlash as described in Step 5, under DIFFERENTIAL. To reduce backlash, loosen the right side adjusting ring until the measured backlash is within specification. The tooth contact pattern should now have the same general shape and location as shown in Figure 66. If the contact pattern still does not conform, less backlash than normal is required. To avoid reducing differential bearing preload excessively, further loosening of the right hand adjusting ring should be accompanied by equal tightening of the left hand adjusting ring. Decreasing backlash moves the ring gear toward the pinion.

If the pattern is concentrated at the toe (as shown in Figure 68), more back- lash is required. Recheck backlash. To increase backlash, tighten the right side adjusting ring further until the measured backlash is within specification. The tooth contact pattern should now spread more across the ring gear tooth as in Figure 66 . If the contact pattern still does not conform, more backlash than normal is required. To avoid increasing differential bearing preload excessively, further tightening of the right hand adjusting ring should be accompanied by equal loosening of the left hand adjusting ring. Increasing backlash moves the ring gear away from the pinion.

If a pattern is concentrated at the ring gear tooth root as shown in Figure 69, the pinion is too close to the ring gear. It must be moved out and away to establish its proper mounting distance and contact pattern as shown in Figure 66. This is accomplished by choosing a thicker pinion position cage shim. Re-adjust pinion-to-ring gear backlash, as required, once proper pinion mounting distance has been established.

figure.caption: Figure 69. Pattern At The Ring Gear Tooth

step1.para: If pattern is concentrated at the tooth top land (as shown in Figure 70), the pinion is too far away from the ring gear and must be moved closer to the ring gear to establish its proper mounting distance and tooth contact pattern. This is accomplished by selecting a thinner pinion position cage shim. Re-adjust pinion-to-ring gear backlash as required once proper pinion mounting distance has been established.

figure.caption: Figure 70. Pattern At Tooth Top Land

step1.para: After proper ring gear pattern is achieved, again tighten the differential bearing cap bolts to specifications in the TORQUE CHART, 13.0.. Install adjusting ring retainers and bolts and tighten to 20 to 30 ft-lbs. (27 to 41 N•m). ( Figure 71).

figure.caption: Figure 71. Tighten Differential Bearing Cap Bolts
